text:
I’m currently studying and designing tools for web scraping/automation. You can see a demo of a tool I made that lets users record their actions on a web page to generate a draft automation script: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z2v8mo-xw3o>. And a short talk about our work: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IyV_xH_kIBQ&list=PLkTCpJUe8hMwLV4miGQbqiqpAYXy4XfN-&index=4>

We’ve recently built a new tool that captures and embeds website UI state within an IDE, provides feedback on CSS selector validity, and more, and I’m looking for JavaScript programmers to participate in a 90 minute user study to test it out. We’ll compensate you with an Amazon gift card of $25 USD (or equivalent currency). Prior experience with web scraping or test automation (e.g., Selenium, Puppeteer, Cypress) is welcome but not necessary! If interested, please fill out this form and I will get in touch with you:
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScMhUTvnlT--qaJcPypxO7nskUP4obod8qOnYi2HgsfRpJJYQ/viewform>
